alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:08PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cochise County through 400 PM MST... At 308 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near and east of Douglas, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Bisbee-Douglas Airport and Pirtleville. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 358 and 377. Route 191 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
